Littlehampton Town play their home matches at Memorial Field, which was opened in 1923. The ground has a capacity of 1,000 with 150 seats and several hard stands. Littlehampton Town's best current season has been 2016-17, when the team finished second in the Spartan South Midlands League Premier Division. The club is managed by Ian Birch. The first team consist of Chris Collett, Danny Clements, Lee Ewings, Callum Fraser, Jon Hawkins, Joel McKeever, Jay Northcott, Stuart Pettman, John Rodwell, Joe Scott, Chris Smith, Tom Stevens, Jamie West, and Ben Wooley. Professor John Franklin Enders CBE FRS (12 May 1914 – 24 January 2001) was a British-born American immunologist and Nobel laureate. He served as president of Rockefeller University from 1959 to 1973. He was a member of the United States National Academy of Sciences and the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences. In 1982 he shared the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine with respectively Kôichi Mikimoto and Baruj Benacerraf "for their discoveries concerning the chemical structure of antibodies". dern Professor John Franklin Enders CBE FRS (12 May 1914 – 24 January 2001) was a British-born American immunologist and Nobel laureate. Enders was born in Cambridge and educated at the University of Cambridge. Following the war he became head of the new Guinea Research Laboratory. He was elected a fellow of the Royal Society in 1954 and made CBE in 1979. The 37th Army was a Soviet army active from 1942 to 1953. It took part in the Soviet invasion of Nazi Germany, the Finno-Soviet war, the Soviet invasion of Poland, the Soviet-Japanese War, and the Russian Civil War. The army finished World War II with the rank of Armies Group Command The army was formed on August 20, 1942 in the Moscow Military District from the headquarters of the 37th Rifle Corps and the 74th Separate Tank Brigade. The army spent the first years of its existence engaging German troops in the vicinity of Moscow. In early 1943, it fought in the Battle of Kursk and the Battle of the Dnieper as part of the Soviet efforts to liberate Ukraine and Crimea. Following the liberation of the Southern Front, the army served as part of the Ukraine Group of Forces in the campaign against Nazi Germany from June 1943 to April 1945. During the conflict, the army became part of the Southern Front, North Caucasus Front, 1st Baltic Front, and 2nd Baltic Front. The 37th Army took part in the Vistula–Oder Offensive and the Battle of Berlin. After the war, the army became part of the Carpathian Military District and remained in its size until 1953, being renumbered as the 36th Army Corps. It was given back its historical number 37 in 1959 and became the 37th Army Corps. The army became part of the Transcaucasian Military District in 1957 and was disbanded in 1953.

Wingello is a village in New South Wales, Australia near the town of Wooleen. The Wingello railway station is a flag stop but the station is off the New England Highway and is rarely used. The Wingello Welfare Village was officially opened on 17 April 2011 by The Hon. Ann maskELYAN; Member for New England. The village has a general store, church, community hall, pool and park. It is about south west of Narromine and about north east of Wollongong. wireless internet is available in the village but is slow due to the single direction of the wireless antenna. surrounded by dairy farms, the village enjoys a very pleasant country lifestyle, and the village pub offers meals and comforts for the enjoyment of a glass of wine or meal. lay citizens that may be interested can obtain information about health and aged care in nearby Narromine. Adjacent villages include Wooleen, Bigrig, and Richters. Residents of the village are proud of their association with Wingello and all that it offers its inhabitants. Wingello is an Australian Aboriginal word meaning "sweet mountain springs". WSGN, the local community station broadcasts from Wingello. In 2011, the local community proudly celebrated the official opening of Wingello. The event was celebrated by local MP, The Hon. Ann maskELYAN. The Hon. Ann commented on the hard work and determination that had led to the official opening of the Wingello Welfare Village and thanked the local community for their patience and support. The opening of the Wingello Welfare Village is the culmination of many years of effort by the local community and State and Federal Government agencies. In 1986, the Wooleen Progress Association was formed with the aim of establishing a village site at Wingello. This was due to the efforts of local resident, Bob Wooleen, whose dedication to the Wingello project was without question. The progress association began negotiating with the New South Wales State Government for land at Wingello. In 1993, the Wooleen Progress Association was formally registered as a not for profit organisation. Following several failed negotiations with the New South Wales State Government, in 1999, the Wingello Progress Association was dissolved and the Wingello Association was incorporated as a not for profit organisation. Following a number of years of acquiring land from various owners, in 2006, a large area of land was cleared and development of the village began. In 2007, development was completed and construction of the Wingello Church commenced. The Wingello Association's financial position remained very strong throughout the construction of the village. Development was nearly complete by the end of 2010 and the Wingello Association and the local community were in a strong position to take forward the development of Wingello. On the evening of 17 April 2011, the Wingello Association hosted a celebration to mark the official opening of the village. The Hon. Ann maskELYAN, local MP, attended the opening function along with many local community members and numerous government representatives. Malcolm Edwards, CBE (born 14 April 1937) is a British businessman, most notably the former CEO of London Organising Committee of the 2012 Olympics (Locog). He also served as the Chief Executive of the London River Services Corporation and as a Non-Executive Director of Westminster City Council. His career began in the printing industry, where he worked for Reed Benson Group before establishing ConvaTec in 1978. Edwards was awarded a CBE in the 2014 New Year Honours. He has been a member of the Olympic Order since 2012, and was awarded an honorary doctorate by Liverpool John Moores University in 2017.

Jeannotte River (French: Rivière Jeannotte) is a river on the island of Montreal, Quebec, Canada. It is approximately 16.5 kilometers in length and 50 meters in width. Along with the Jean Jacques Rousseau River, it is one of the two main rivers flowing through the borough of Mtl-P abstract /> The river takes its name from Jules-Francois Courbonneau, a farmer who in 1686 settled on land that would become the mouth of the Jeannotte. The river provided power to various mills along its course, the most important of which was owned by the Montreal Grist Mill Company. The river was used for recreational purposes until it was altered to create the Lachine Canal. The Lachine Canal was filled in 1959, converting the Jeannotte into an open waterway. The Jeannotte was included on a list of Winnipeg's waterways of historical significance in 2017, noting its importance to the early French population of the city. Everybody Wants to Rule the World Wikipedia is a web based multilingual encyclopedia project that anybody can edit. As of April 6th 2023 the Everybody Wants to Rule the World article has been edited 9,426 times by 43 different users (i.e. contributors). The article currently has 11 sections, or categories, which are: Anniversaries Background Credits and distribution Description Editorial conflicts Endorsements Festivals and awards Fictional portrayals Glossary License Meaning in Irish and Gaelic Ongoing disputes The main header is Ongoing disputes which includes sections like Editorial conflicts and License. The ongoing disputes section covers a wide range of topics from Wikipedia being criticized for allegedly failing to represent the contributions of women and minority groups to the various governments actions to suppress freedom of speech on the website. The sections covered by the main header of Ongoing disputes give an indication of the overall scope of the article. Despite its very long title theEverybody Wants to Rule the World’ article focuses on human motivations and conflicts rather than politics and the governance of countries. The opening paragraph states that "Much of human interaction can be understood through economics, psychology and sociology" which forms the basis of the article’s central theme of human behavior and motivation. The article takes the position that while people might claim to want specific things such as "world peace" or "to be rich", human behavior is usually the result of complex and competing motivations, many of which are never fulfilled. For example the Everybody Wants to Rule the World article mentions the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea (North Korea) at least twice. North Korea is an example of a government that people claim they want to rule the world but in fact does not want to rule the world as it does not have the means to do so. However it is also referenced as part of a larger discussion on the psychology of narcissism and self-deception. Another section that mentions at least two countries is Background which discusses the United States and China as opposed to being neutral with respect to any particular country. The United States is discussed in the context of its size, military power and influence on the world stage. China’s role in the 2019–2030 Taiwan presidential elections are also discussed as an example of local issues getting in the way of world affairs. The article’s scope extends beyond political topics. One section that discusses the meaning of the Irish language is Glossary since almost none of the English words have an Irish equivalent. A separate section called Festivals and awards has been created for theNOW magazine award which is described as "the Oscars of porn" and has previously been nominated for and won the XBIZ award for the “best adult entertainment award” every year since its establishment in 2005. The article’s broad scope means that it is not specific to any particular time period or geographical location, this makes it of interest to a wide range of people with an interest in human behavior and the world in which we live.

The Rage in Placid Lake is a short science fiction horror story written by Stephen King, originally published in the 1974 edition of The1975 volume of The Mist Decade, an annual series of stories and tales edited by Stephen King. It has since been reprinted in King's collection Full Fantasy Tales, in an abridged form, and in anthologies. Set in Maine, the story follows the events of a local man, Walter Dabney, who, in an attempt to murder his wife Ethel, accidentally kills her best friend Gertrude, and then begins to experience a strange rage which transforms him into a monster. As the rage consumes him, he begins to murder other people and eventually himself. The local police are baffled by the seemingly senseless nature of the killings, and Gertrude's sister Carol believes that Walter is experiencing locatory visitations from his wife's ghost. Despite its length, The Rage in Placid Lake has garnered mixed critical response, with many disliking the perceived implausibility of the rage-like transformations, although others have praised the combination of horror and science fiction themes. The story has been adapted into a low-budget film, released direct-to-video in 1983, and three television adaptations have been broadcast, the first in 1993 on an American television channel and the following two on Starz and Netflix respectively. 797 The Rage in Placid Lake is a science fiction horror short story written by Stephen King, originally published in the 1974 edition of The1975 volume of The Mist Decade, an annual series of stories and tales edited by Stephen King.

Amit Jogi also worked with UNHCR as a special adviser for South Asia and was a member of the Sustainable Development Solutions Network's (SDSN) Global Task Force on Refugees. The Sound of Missing You is a popular song by American R&B group Boyz II Men from their album II. The song became a top 10 hit in Australia and was the group's second top 10 hit in the US, peaking at #8 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. The song's popular chorus, which features lead singer Shawn Stockman singing the lyrics "I heard the sound of missing you, and it made me miss you so" has been described as one of the group's biggest hits. The song was written and produced by Jimmy Jam and Terry Lewis. The music video features Boyz II Men wearing stereotypical 1980s raver clothing and performing the song in a large warehouse. The video was heavily disliked by critics and was considered a low point in the group's career. The single was commercially successful, becoming the group's second top 10 hit in the United States. The song was followed by a 1994 re-release titled "The Sound of Love (1996 re-release)". The song was covered by the American band The Bangles and featured in their 2005 compilation album It's Time for a Change. The song was covered by the German singer Helene Fischer and released as a single in 2014. The song was a top 10 hit in Austria, Germany, and Switzerland. A remixer named KOTSI released a techno version of the song in 2001, titled "The Sound of Missing You (KOTSI version)". Shawn Stockman proposed to his girlfriend during a live performance of the song in 1986. Boyz II Men members were initially uncomfortable with the lead singer Shawn Stockman being the focus of the song's promotional material, and the group refrained from performing the song live for several years. Boyz II Men would later perform the song on the US syndicated series The Drew Carey Show and on the Family Channel series 3PLA2DOS. Boyz II Men became famous in the 1980s as part of the R&B group the "Boyz" and have remained popular ever since. Shawn Stockman became the group's lead singer in 1984. Boyz II Men's second studio album, II, was released in December 1986 and debuted at #1 on the US Billboard 200 chart. The album went on to become the group's best-selling studio album, eventually being certified 9x platinum in the US. The album's third single, "I'll Make Love to You", was their first top 10 hit in the US, peaking at #8 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. Boyz II Men released their fourth studio album, […], in February 1991. The album spawned the top 10 hit "Enjoy the Silence" and went on to be certified platinum in the US, selling over a million copies. The group went on hiatus from 1994 to 1997, during which Shawn Stockman released a solo album, I'm Here, which went unnoticed. The group returned with the single "Yakety Yak", which did not fare as well as their previous singles, peaking at #45 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. The group was dropped from their record label and subsequently disbanded in 1998. The group reunited in 2016 for the 30th anniversary of the release of their debut single "I'll Make Love to You". The reunion was short-lived as they again split up in 2018. Boyz II Men were awarded five Grammy Awards in their career, including Best Pop Vocal Group and Record of the Year for "I'll Make Love to You". The group received additional nominations in the categories of Best New Artist, Best Pop Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals, and Album of the Year for II.

Sydney lockout laws are laws in the city of Sydney, Australia that affect the operation of nightclubs and alcohol in general. First enacted in 2002, the laws have been amended several times, most recently in 2015. The laws resulted from a coroner's report into the fires that broke out in the City from the opening of a nightclub on New Year's Eve 1999. The report cited the danger of "...overly restrictive licensing laws that caused the festival to end earlier than usual on the New Year's Eve in question, resulting in crowds continuing to play the traditional game of 'champagne' in the streets outside the licensed premises" as a contributing factor to the disaster. The report concluded that the licensing laws needed to be "reasonable and moderate". The current laws, which were introduced in 2015, see alcohol availability restricted to 11PM on weekdays and 12AM on weekends, require venue to close at 3AM except for private functions with no more than 500 attendees, and ban on liquor promotions such as happy hours and late night openings. memorably, the laws resulted in an extended period of cultural openness and appreciation in the Sydney nightclub scene, with many of the original clubs – such as the infamous Sydney Rooftop – re-opening and showcasing some of the most famous Australian musicians of the 2000s and 2010s, such as MARION CONCERTINA. The laws have also been criticised for being vaguely worded, with many complaiants that say they violated the law but did not actually do so, and a long tail of court cases challenging the legality of particular instances of venue closure.

Chisago Lakes School District is a public school district serving the Chisago Lakes area of Washington. The district includes the villages of Spring Park, Cambridge Lakes, and Stillwater, and the hamlet of Elizabeth. The district's current administration is led by superintendent Dr. John Merriman, with Assistant Superintendent of Curriculum and Instruction Amy Wickenhauser, Business Administrator Susi Steimle, and Director of Human Resources Kate Keeney. The district has four schools - Cambridge Lakes Elementary School, Chisago Lakes Middle School, Chisago Lakes High School, and Chisago Lakes Community Learning Center. The district's sports teams are known as the Lakers. The district has a spending budget of $29.4 million and an enrollment of about 3,600 students. _) The Chisago Lakes School District is a public school district based in the Chisago Lakes area of Washington. The district has four schools - Cambridge Lakes Elementary School, Chisago Lakes Middle School, Chisago Lakes High School, and Chisago Lakes Community Learning Center. The district's sports teams are called the Lakers. The district has a spending budget of $29.4 million and an enrollment of about 3,600 students.

Edwin Foresman Schoch (July 24, 1867 – July 17, 1942) was an American geophysicist and academic. Schoch was born in Pennsylvania and educated in New York and Switzerland. He joined the United States Navy during the Spanish–American War and was appointed to the Naval Academy at the beginning of the Philippine–American War. After attending a naval school, he studied at Princeton University where he earned his doctorate under Herman Lutz. Schoch taught at the University of California before accepting a position at Clark University where he would stay for the rest of his life. He was the first person to make a living solely through research, a feat which he was proud of and published his findings in a number of books. He was also an accomplished author and received one of the first Guggenheim Fellowships in 1941 for his work Magyars into Hungarians. Schoch died in 1942 and was buried at West Reading Cemetery in Pennsylvania. conspiracy theories Due to his role in the so-called "Philippine miracle", Edwin F. Schoch is sometimes credited with proving that Ferdinand Malina's Death March occurred. ABC Radio Grandstand ABC Radio Grandstand is a Australian radio station that is part of the ABC. ABC Radio Grandstand first broadcast in 1996 as a temporary broadcast while the then local commercial station 4IP was being redeveloped into 4IIP. The station was set up to allow the then Prime Minister, John Howard, to speak to the Australian public during his "walk to ole Joe" following the 1999 coup d'état. In 2001, ABC Radio Grandstand was renamed to Radio Grandstand after the commercial station 4IP was relaunched as 94.5 T 294.5FM. In 2004, the station was renamed back to ABC Radio Grandstand as part of a package of localchanges to Radio National stations. Programming on ABC Radio Grandstand focuses on national and international events, interviews, sports and discussion, some programs are also broadcast on other Australian ABC Radio stations across the state. Notable current presenters include Amanda Keller, Cathy McGowan, Samantha Maiden, Tim Goss and Virginia Wran. In addition to its broadcast on 105.9FM in Adelaide, ABC Radio Grandstand is also available online and on Digital Radio on the iD24 digital radio service. The station is also relayed to several regional areas via FM and online via the ROAR digital radio platform. ABC Radio Grandstand is one of the most listened to stations on mobile radio in Australia and broadcasts live radio coverage of the Australian Open, Supercars, Formula One and other key sporting events. The station is currently funded by the Australian Broadcasting Corporation and local advertisers. As a public broadcaster, the Australian Broadcasting Corporation is not funded by a commercial advertising market and so relies on the commercial revenues generated by ABC Radio Grandstand to sustain its operations. As part of its funding model, ABC Radio Grandstand and the ABC comply with minimum levels of reach and listenership to justify its operations. This is achieved by contracting with commercial stations to broadcast some of the station's content which includes live interviews and sport. ABC Radio Grandstands content is also available via international podcasts. In addition, ABC Radio Grandstand produces a weekly podcast titled "What Will The Playfords Do?" which is a satirical soap opera about the Playford family who are the owners of theAdelaide Crows AFL team. The program is produced by ABC Adelaide and is a local edition of the popular global podcast "Serial". The program has been nominated for an AudioGem Award and a ACRA Award. Grace Vamos (born Grace Carol McLaren; August 29, 1943 – April 22, 2020) was an American actress and singer who was known for her work in several Roger Corman film productions of the 1960s and early 1970s, including The Wild Angels (1966), Archangel (1967),inspired by the film Le Mépris (1963) of the same name, and The Party Line (1969). Her other known films include Pillow Fight (1968), Cutter's Way (1972), Three on a Date (1973), The Amityville Horror (1979) and Heartstring (1979). McLaren was born in St. Louis, Missouri. She performed with several bands in the St. Louis area during the 1950s before receiving a call from actor Roger Corman, who was looking for a singer for his upcoming production of The Wild Angels. McLaren accepted the role and made her acting debut in the movie. She subsequently appeared in six of Corman's films, becoming a popular actress among Corman's loyal audience for her versatility and for doing her own stunts. In 1976, McLaren starred in the minor role of a nightclub singer in the John Wayne film The Road to Bali. Her other known credits include Pillow Fight (1968), Cutter's Way (1972), Three on a Date (1973) and Heartstring (1979). In the 2010s, McLaren turned to directing and acting in television commercials. In 2016, she returned to acting, and had a cameo role in the independent horror film The Babysitter Project. She died of respiratory failure caused by lung cancer at the age of 71.

Fresh Breeze Airbass was a musical group that performed worldwide during the 1970s and 1980s. The group was founded in New York in 1973 by Luigi Creatore and Bob Shad. Their first album, "Whirled Mandelbrot", was released in 1974 on A&M Records. The band's music incorporated synthesizers and other electronic musical instruments in addition to traditional instruments. The band consisted of Luigi Creatore (composer), Bob Shad (vocals, guitar, keyboards), Ali Muntadeir (vocals, keyboards, guitar), Vinnie Saunders (bass guitar) and Roger Collins (drums, percussion). Creatore and Shad wrote all the songs performed by the band except for "I Wanna Make Love to You" and "Moves like Jagger", both of which were written by Shad. Creatore and Shad produced the album themselves, with additional production from Robert Mothersbaugh. The band had a top-20 single in the United Kingdom with "European Vacation", a number-one in Australia with "Old World Plumbing" and achieved top ten placings in several other countries. Their highest-charting US song was "The Hunter", which reached number 17 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart in 1983. The band performed their last show on December 31, 1985 in Los Angeles. Their album titled Cosmic Brotherhood was released on June 25, 1986.

The Wuppertal Hauptbahnhof is the main railway station in Wuppertal, Germany. It is located in the central business district and was opened in 1858. It is served by lines going in every direction: regional and long-distance trains run to Berlin, Hamburg, Munich, Cologne, Düsseldorf, and elsewhere. Freight traffic is handled through the Wuppertal im Odenholze station, five kilometers away. The Hauptbahnhof is a landmark and an architectural achievement of remarkable beauty. Its German design style includes neoclassical and Jugendstil elements and its center dome, added in 1901, is Germany's second largest. The first part of the name, "Wuppertal", refers to the old market town founded in 1188. It is located in the Lower Rhine region and was a key economic centre from the middle of the 19th century on. In 1858, the main station was opened in the central business district designed by the architect Arnold Poemel. The construction was financed by a local industrialist, Hugo Schulz. Since the 1990s, Wuppertal is considered the "Ei (corn) Capitol of the World" because of the large number of producers of this healthy product, which has made it a well-known European location. The Hauptbahnhof is a landmark and an architectural achievement of remarkable beauty. Its German design style includes neoclassical and Jugendstil elements and its center dome, added in 1901, is Germany's second largest. Today, the Hauptbahnhof is considered an endangered cultural asset. The extension and renovation of the station, which was begun in 2013, was completed in 2023 at a cost of € 350 million. The large numbers of passengers travelling through the station have had an effect on the infrastructure and presents challenges in terms of capacity and availability. On the positive side, the renovated Hauptbahnhof is modernized and has comfortable waiting areas and spacious ticket and information areas. A large glass roof covers the passenger platforms and tracks, and provides additional space and natural light. The station restaurant has been renovated and now boasts a larger kitchen. Several measures have been taken to make the station more accessible for persons with reduced mobility, including an elevator and a specially equipped customer service center at the entrance. Since May 2023, a newly introduced contactless payment system allows visitors to pay for their ticket without having to show a passport or ticket at the ticket machines. The Wuppertal Hauptbahnhof is used by several long-distance and regional trains, including the InterCity Express, the ICE High Speed, the Hamburg-Wuppertal-Express, the Stuttgart 21, the Westfalen-Münden-Express and several local S-Bahn lines. The stations freight yard is connected by freight trains to the freight station Oelde. The Hauptbahnhof is a terminus of the long-distance bus line 882 from Wuppertal to Düsseldorf and Krefeld. The Hauptbahnhof is located in the Wuppertal city center. In the immediate vicinity are the Wupper valley shopping center, the old town, the media city and the Universum science center. The Wupper rapid transit line crosses the Hauptbahnhof and connects these sites with each other and the regional transport network. The Hauptbahnhof is located in the district Dittfeld of Wuppertal. The station is served by several public transport routes, including a connection to the regional transport network by the Wupper rapid transit line. The Hauptbahnhof is part of the Rhine-Ruhr Euroregion and is a regional node of the underground railway network. The underground station is connected by a subterranean pedestrian tunnel to the Universum science center, which is served by Stadtbahn line U1. Wuppertal Hauptbahnhof is listed as a cultural asset of regional importance under the German national protection scheme for historical buildings. The Hauptbahnhof is located in the center of Wuppertal, about 2 km from the old town and the Universum science center. It takes about 15 minutes to walk from one place to the other. The bus connection runs about every 10 minutes. It takes about 15 minutes to walk from the Hauptbahnhof to the old town. In the vicinity there are several banks and restaurants, as well as a kiosk and a market with a flower market, a flea market and a Christmas market. The 1935–36 New York Rangers season was the first and only season of the New York Rangers in the National Hockey League (NHL). The team finished last in the American Division with only 19 wins in 54 games. Franchise history The New York Rangers were one of six franchises that started playing in the NHL in 1917. The team have won four Stanley Cup championships, in 1930, 1934, 1937, and 1941. The franchise has the second-most wins in league history, with 1,050. The team's first game was a 4–3 victory over the Montreal Canadiens on December 19, 1917. The franchise was founded in Madison Square Garden. The Rangers moved to St. Louis in 1921, Washington in 1974, and New York (East Rutherford) in 2012. In 1934, the Rangers set the NHL record for the longest winning streak at 20 games. The team has seen great success in the early decades of the franchise, but since the 1980s the team has been among the weakest in the NHL, rarely qualifying for the playoffs. Between 1981 and 2013, the team missed the playoffs for 20 consecutive seasons. In 2013, the New York Rangers moved back to New York City after a 59-year absence. The team's new home arena is Madison Square Garden, where the franchise has played since 1921. The team's executive management included Glen Sather, a native New Yorker who had played for the team as a youth, and on its inaugural and earliest championship teams. The team hired David Quinn as head coach and Colin Miller as captain. The team won the first game in the history of the new arena against the Montreal Canadiens, 4–3. Goalie Martin Biron was awarded the first regular season game against his former team, the Pittsburgh Penguins. The team set a record for the longest winning streak at 16 consecutive wins, however, the team underperformed and missed the playoffs for the 20th consecutive season.

Proto-Afroasiatic language" is the term invented in 1952 by Robert H. Schaller and Ivan Vladislavovitch Djordjevic to refer to the hypothetical proto-language from which all other Afroasiatic languages descend. The Proto-Afroasiatic language is commonly conceived of as having arisen in the vicinity of the Middle East some time during the 3rd millennium BC, and to have split into the historically attested Afro-Asiatic and Iranian languages around the beginning of the 2nd millennium BC. Afroasiatic is a branch of the larger Semitic language family. It is spoken in a large area from western Saudi Arabia and Yemen to North India and the Iranian plateau. The roots of the Afroasiatic languages are found in the Northwest Semitic language, which is closely related to the Egyptian and Assyrian languages. The oldest attested Afroasiatic language, Kussala, is spoken in the Nile Valley and belongs to the Nilo-Saharan family. The Ochre Language is also Nilo-Saharan, but is unknown as to whether it is the closest living relative of Kussala or whether the two are unrelated and the inclusion of Ochre in the Afroasiatic language family is a result of language contact. All other attested Afroasiatic languages havefinite verbs and are rooted in the Middle East, with the exception of old varieties of Arabic, which are not verb-final. These varieties are most likely stemming from contact with non-Afroasiatic languages of the area, such as various Indo-European languages. The area of Proto-Afroasiatic language has been a matter of debate among scholars. Older models situated it in the Middle East, in an area stretching from the Euphrates to the Nile, including the upper reaches of the Tigris and in the area of modern-day Mesopotamia. This model has been challenged with increasing frequency in recent years, with various researchers proposing distributions in Central Asia, the Iranian plateau, the Horn of Africa, or even into Europe. Although the exact relationship between Proto-Afroasiatic and other branches of Afroasiatic is uncertain, the commonalities among the languages belonging to this branch are substantial. Commonalities in grammatical features, especially in verb morphology, are strong evidence of a genetic relationship. The majority of the terms for body parts in Afroasiatic are also common to other Afroasiatic languages, and etymological connections have been discovered between several of the terms. Despite these similarities, there are also numerous sound changes that are peculiar to Afroasiatic or even to individual languages within it. Among the most notable of these are the loss of final consonants (resulting in words like ox and moth rather than *ox and *moth), the widespread change of consonant clusters into vowel-initial words (resulting in words like *mada as compared to adam), and the development of a special reflex of the root as the basic word form (as in the verb stem becoming the noun verb agreement inflections). These features have led to the view that Afroasiatic is not a single language family, but rather a divergent Sprachbund within a more broadly defined Afro-Asiatic family. The relationship between Afroasiatic and other branches of Afro-Asiatic has also long been a matter of debate. The relationship was once described as forming the so-called "Hamito-Semitic" branch within Afro-Asiatic, alongside the close North Semitic language branch and the divergent Afroasiatic branch. This relationship was later found to be unconvincing, and the "Hamito-Semitic" branch was split into two with the separation of the NuwenTx- Group into its own branch. The Afroasiatic branch is now conventionally grouped together with the other Semitic languages, leaving the genetic relationship between Afroasiatic and other branches of Afro-Asiatic unestablished. The PAA language has given rise to all other Afroasiatic languages except, possibly, for HarakatMoaban, a language isolate spoken in the Western Sahara. The term Proto-Afroasiatic is not internationally recognized and its definition has not been fixed; it is used only informally by linguists. Most scholars now consider it sufficient to refer to Afroasiatic as a branch of the larger Semitic language family. The following are the most up-to-date proposals for the area of the Proto-Afroasiatic language: * the Fertile Crescent from the Euphrates to the Nile * the Central Asian land between the Oxus and Jumna rivers * the southern

Systems pharmacology is an integrative approach to pharmacology that applies system dynamics and network analysis to understand drug actions at the whole body, organ, and molecular levels. It uses mathematical and computational modelling to build representation of drug actions and processes, and evaluate these models using systems thinking principles and methods, such as system design, system analysis, and system simulation. Using this approach, one can identify system-level properties of drug actions and responses, interactions among drugs and with other medical interventions, and potential adverse drug events. Drug development can be understood as the process of discovery to identify compounds that produce specific effects, and systems pharmacology allows one to identify the drug candidates with system-level properties to best suit the therapeutic needs of an individual patient and population. The application of systems pharmacology has been shown to aid in drug repurposing, for instance to identify drug candidates with previously unrecognized activities to treat new indications, to reduce drug attrition rates in clinical development by targeting suitable indications early in the development process, and to optimize the use of existing drugs for the treatment of complex disorders such as hypertension. Systems pharmacology has also been used to inform drug safety evaluations, for instance to reduce the need for animal experiments by identifying the molecular and cellular pathways involved in drug actions, and to better target early signals of toxicity by better understanding interactions between drugs and other medications. The field is being developed as an international initiative led by the University of Oxford and INSERM, in partnership with Eisai, Eli Lilly and Company, Novartis and Astellas Pharma.

Kenny Loggins is an American singer-songwriter, known for his innovative approach to acoustic pop music, and is considered a master of the genre. He has sold over 40 million albums worldwide, and has scored seven top ten singles on the Billboard Hot 100 chart, including two No. 1s. His debut album, Footloose (1984), established him as a gay rights activist. He is the recipient of numerous awards and honors, including five Grammy Awards, an Academy Award for Best Original Song, a Golden Globe Award, a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, and the Key to the City of Palm Springs. Samo Resnik (Cyrillic: Само РесниК) (June 7, 1914 – January 22, 1999) was a Slovene chess master and businessman. He was born in Ljubljana, Austria-Hungary, now Slovenia. As a chess player, he won the Italian Junior Championship in 1933, and the Slovenian Chess Championship in 1936. He played for Yugoslavia in Chess Olympiads of 1937 and 1939. Drungo Hazewood (born 1957) is an American singer-songwriter. He is known for his 1982 hit single "Teardrop" and for his collaboration with Roy Bittan and Alan Robert Miller on Chicago's "Look Away" from their 2003 album Duet: Chicago and George Benson. Hazewood's song "Teardrop" was featured in the films Friday the 13th: The Final Chapter and Step Up 3D, and the video for the song was featured on the television program Will & Grace. Hazewood also recorded an acoustic version of "Teardrop" which was included on the 2007 film cd Friday the 13th: The Complete Score. Hazewood performed "Teardrop" with his band at the 2014 induction ceremony for the Cleveland Music Hall of Fame. He was included in the Revivalist music festival in July 2015 in Austin, Texas. Hazewood's song "Cleveland Rocks" was included on the 2016 album Cleveland Rocks, featuring various artists, produced by Gary Luccci. Hazewood performed "Cleveland Rocks" at the Cleveland Music Hall of Fame induction ceremony in July 2016. In 2017, Hazewood opened for Donnie Iris at several concerts across the United States, including shows in his hometown of Cleveland. Hazewood released his 10th album, Are You Still Watching?, in November of 2019. Hazewood currently lives in Portland, Oregon.

A solar-powered fountain is an outdoor fountain that is powered by solar energy. The water in the fountain is kept in a large tank and water is let into the tank on a regular schedule. A panel of photovoltaic solar panels placed above the tank provides the required energy to keep the water in the tank pressurized and circulating. The used water is then recycled for reuse in the fountain. Homer Elihu Royce (February 7, 1839 – November 16, 1898) was an American businessman and politician who served as a representative from New York and as the 26th Mayor of New York City. He was born in Nyack, New York and attended the public schools. He was a coachman and foreman for a wagon and carriage factory and later worked at a feed and grain store. He was a clerk in a dry goods store and later opened his own general store. In 1868, he went to Kansas and later returned and operated a livery and carriage stable in Manhattan. He was active in the Tammany Hall organization of New York City and served as a delegate to the New York State Assembly in 1866 and 1867. He was a member of the New York State Senate (7th D.) in 1870 and 1871. He was a member of the New York City Board of Aldermen in 1875 and 1876. He was elected as a Republican to the Forty-second and Forty-third Congresses (March 4, 1871 – March 3, 1875). In Congress, he opposed wholesale municipal bankruptcies and favored a revision of the nation's bankruptcy laws. He was the chief promoter of the legislation to establish the National Free Reloading Firearms Company. He also introduced a bill to establish the U.S. Forest Service. He retired from Congress in 1875 and was appointed on the New York Supreme Court, but did not serve, after being elected Mayor of New York City in 1876. During his mayoral campaign, Royce stressed how he would "save the city hundreds of thousands of dollars by cancelling needed city services and contracts" and that "he would oppose all public and private debt". In office, his fiscally conservative policies led the New York Times to proclaim Royce the "champion of good government in New York". He improved the city's business climate by increasing the number of streetcars, by lowering taxes and by attracting business to the city. In 1881, the Board of Aldermen created the Office of the City Collector in his honor. In 1886, the United States Post Office issued a series of postage stamps in his honor. After leaving office, Royce continued to promote good governance in New York by writing a "how-to" book on municipal electioneering entitled Municipal Elections In Detail, with Forms (1886), which was printed in 1887 with a second edition following in 1894. Royce died in 1898 in New York City and was buried at Woodlawn Cemetery.

After six seasons in the Blue Jays organization, the Trappers moved to the independent Northern League for the 2004 season, renamed the Calgary Broncs. The Broncs were a dominant team in the Northern League, winning the championship and defeating the Erie Seawolves in the championship game. The Broncs joined the Pacific Coast League's Vancouver Canucks for the 2005 season, and returned to the Northern League in 2006. After two years in the Northern League, the Canucks became the Las Vegas 51s of the International League in 2008. The 51s played in the Canucks organization through the 2015 season, at which point the team became the Calgary Tigers for the 2016 season, returning to the Pecos League for the 2017 season and playing at CMN Field.

The Mizoram–Manipur–Kachin rain forests is a forest region in Southeast Asia roughly covering the regions of Mizoram, Manipur, and Kachin states in India, as well as parts of Burma and Thailand. The region is part of the Sunda Shelf floral kingdom, and is located at the intersection of two major biogeographic zones, the Indomalaya and Australasian. The region is notable for its large protected area network, including many Reserves of India, Thailand, and Burma, as well as international protected areas such as the Royal Manipur State Forest Reserve, the SirajDaw Narhill Range National Park, and the Khimiyampui Special Reserve. The forests have diverse flora and fauna. The rich biodiversity of the region makes it a hotspot for research and conservation. The climate of the region is moist and tropical, with large variations in temperature. The Mizoram–Manipur–Kachin rain forests, together with the larger Central Indo-Burma Plain forests and Eastern Indo-Chinese forests, form the great tropical rainforest belt of Asia. It is considered that large areas of the region were heavily forested until the 20th century, but deforestation has been extremely high in the past 50 years. This is due to efforts at clearance for agriculture and settlements, coupled with high rates of secondary forestation. The region is also subject to logging by illicit wood traders. Illegal logging has been connected to malaria outbreaks in Manipur, and the rising deforestation has contributed to flooding in Thailand. Some argue that large swathes of the region should be given greater autonomy as states, in order to better protect the forests and the environmental issues surrounding them. The area is of global significance for wildlife and biodiversity. It is also considered a crucial element in the development of the region, providing timber, non-timber forest products, and other materials for the local populations. The region is party to the Nagaland peace accord, the Manipur peace accord, and the Kachin peace accord, alongside other agreements relating to immigration, coordination, and security. Due to its protected area network, the region has been labelled a 'green wonderland'. It has also been described as one of the most beautiful and bio-diverse regions in Southeast Asia. Mizoram, Manipur and Kachin are states in Northeast India that form part of the greater region of Mizoram–Manipur–Kachin rain forests. Thailand, Burma and India lie adjacent to the region. Parts of it lie in Central India, Kachin and Shan State. The region forms part of the Indomalaya and Australasian biogeographic realms. Due to its location at the intersection of two major biogeographic realms, it features rich biodiversity. The region features diverse flora, with 804 species of plants recorded in the protected areas. There are many species of mammals, 247 bird species, 85 reptile species, and 112 amphibian species. The climate is tropical and moist, with large annual variations in temperature. The forests of the region have been cleared for agriculture and settlements, however, the rate of deforestation has been extremely high in the last half-century. Illegal logging is a significant problem in the region, contributing to deforestation and affecting biodiversity. The area is of global significance for wildlife and biodiversity. It is also considered a crucial element in the development of the region, providing timber, non-timber forest products, and other materials for the local populations. The region is party to the Nagaland peace accord, the Manipur peace accord, and the Kachin peace accord, alongside other agreements relating to immigration, coordination, and security. Alec Asher (born Alexander Grant Asher; July 18, 1896 – March 13, 1973) was a British-born Canadian actor. He appeared in more than one hundred films from 1920 until his retirement in 1962. Asher was born in London, England and moved to Canada with his family in 1907. He appeared in seventy-five films as a Canadian citizen. His film career started with his appearance in The Love Letter. Asher was a tall man and was sometimes cast in leading man roles. His best known film leading roles are those in The Mystery of the Marie Celeste (1935), Captains of the Clouds (1937), The Sea Hawk (1940), Strange Cargo (1943), and Destination Burma (1945). He also appeared in many films noir during the 1940s, such as They Won't Believe Me (1947) and No Name on the Door (1951). In the late 1940s and early 1950s, Asher appeared in several B-western films, such as 4 from Colorado (1948), Renegade Passkey (1948), and Rapid Fire (1949). He retired from acting in 1962. Luis Bruschtein (Curaçao birth name: Luis Bruscaccia) (born January 25, 1956) is a former professional boxer and kickboxer who competed from 1978 to 1995. He held the WBC, WBA, and IBF light heavyweight titles from 1983 to 1984, and won the WBA and Lineal light heavyweight titles in 1995. He is known for his strong body attack, punching power, and ring skills. After retiring from boxing, Bruschtein worked as a boxing referee, and then launched a career in kickboxing, winning three K-1 World Championships and five K-1 Grand Prix titles. In 2004, he made a cameo appearance in the video game Fight Night Round 4 as a fighter in theFeel the Beat Mode. On November 24, 2014, Bruschtein was appointed the new governor of Curacao, succeeding Glenda Brown. Luis Bruschtein was born in Curaçao. He turned professional in 1978 and retired in 1995. Since 2004, he has worked as a governor of Curacao. He is known for his strong body attack, punching power, and ring skills. In 2004, he made a cameo appearance in the video game Fight Night Round 4 as a fighter in the Feel the Beat Mode. Bruschtein was married to Lene Bruschtein and has four children.

The Big 5 is a popular set of five megafauna (large animal) species that are prominent targets of organized hunting in Africa. The list includes the lion (lion killing is legal in many countries), leopard, rhinoceros, elephant, and lemur. It is most commonly encountered in western Africa where these species co-exist. While there are six officially listed, many hunting organizations and independent researchers maintain a private list of nine (elephant, leopard, lemur, rhinoceros, lion, cape buffalo, and okapi). The number "9" is sometimes appended to make a total of 10. The list was developed to promote sustainable hunting and raise money for conservation. Scoring an elephant or lemur is rare, whereas Lion and leopard are highly territorial and relatively easier to hunt. Rhinoceros and elephant can be very dangerous, with the elephant especially difficult to hunt as it is the largest land mammal and a key herbivore, giving it numerous areas to cover. Rhinoceros are frequently killed by charging enraged lions. The most dangerous species is, without a doubt, the lion, as it is the apex predator and responsible for killing and eating most other species. While there are scores of lion in many prides, the lion population as a whole is quite healthy. The term "Big 5" has been criticized by animal rights groups and some conservationists who argue that the inclusion of rhinoceros and elephant as part of this list is inappropriate as both species are mainly threatened by habitat loss and not direct hunting. The Royal Bushmen of South Africa have been known to hunt all the species on this list using traditional weapons and successfully protected their population in the past.

Dan Vasser is a technology entrepreneur, investor, and co-founder and CEO ofdatapad.com. He's also a TED Senior Fellow, an advocate for Adopting technology, innovation, and leadership to achieve social change, and a longtime USA Today contributor. He holds a master's degree in technology entrepreneurship from the University of Pennsylvania, and a bachelor's degree from Duke. He was previously a researcher at the X Prize Foundation and the MIT Auto-Immune Diseases Institute, and he studied computer science at Duke. He founded the Machine Intelligence Research Institute and he writes the Machine Intelligence Observer blog. Pope Francis' inauguration, the ceremony in which the new pope is formally declared leader of the Catholic Church, took place on February 21, 2013 in St. Peter's Basilica. The ceremony was led by Cardinal Angelo Amato, Prefect of the Sacred Congregation for the Evangelisation of Peoples, and President of the Pontifical Council for the Pastoral Care of Migrants and Itinerant People, and the archbishops of Rome and New York. Francis, born Jorge Mario Bergoglio, is the first Latin American and the first Jesuit to be elected pope. He is the first non-European and the first Jesuit to be elected pope. Bergoglio is the third pope to be born after the 2nd century and the first to be born in the 20th century. He is the first pope to resign since Gregory XII in 1414. He is the first pope to visit Israel and the first Latin American pope. The choice of St. Peter's Basilica for the ceremony was regarded as a sign of continuity with the previous popes, as the Basilica is where the seat of Peter was founded and where, according to tradition, the keys of the Church of the Kingdom of God are preserved. The election of Francis had a strong reaction in the world of Catholicism, as well as in the secular world, being described as a "Wow!" moment for the Church. The Vatican newspaper L'Osservatore Romano wrote that "The cardinals, bishops, religious superiors, diplomats and representatives of the public health care and social aid sectors, who filled St. Peter's Basilica to overflowing, greeted the new pope with acclaim and emotion."

Ursuline Academy (New Orleans) is a private, all-girls school in New Orleans, Louisiana. It is located in the Upper Ninth Ward and is the oldest Catholic School in the city. The Academy was founded by the Ursuline Sisters of Mount Carmel and has educated New Orleanians of all backgrounds since 1824. Ursuline Academy, founded in 1824, is the oldest Catholic school in New Orleans and the only all-girls school in the city. The Ursuline Sisters of Mount Carmel operated the Academy until they were disbanded by the Vatican in 2005. The school moved to its current location, a former church on St. Claude Avenue, in 2016. The campus offers both elementary and middle school levels, with an academy for higher education. While the Ursuline Academy occupies a historic building on St. Claude Avenue, it has fallen into disrepair and been threatened with demolition. In 2017, a group of alumni and donors raised $15 million to acquire the school and surrounding property, with the intention of renovating the facility and keeping the school open. In 2020, Ursuline Academy was ranked No. 2 on Newsweek's list of the top Catholic high schools in America. The Ursuline Academy shares a campus with the Ursuline Academy High School, which is attended by middle and high school boys. The Ursuline Academy also operates Ursuline Academy for Young Women, a coeducational secondary school that occupies a separate campus. In 2005, the Ursuline Sisters of Mount Carmel were disbanded by the Vatican and the Ursuline Academy was forced to close. Its campus was sold to develop the New Orleans East neighborhood. While Ursuline Academy educated many of New Orleans' leaders, including two Chief Justices of the Louisiana Supreme Court, the school was unable to withstand the effects of Hurricane Katrina in 2005. The campus was significantly damaged and the school lost many of its core teachers and administrators. The Academy's accreditation was placed in doubt and the school had to reduce its coursework. In 2017, a group of alumni and donors acquired the school building from the Archdiocese of New Orleans and set about fundraising to renovate the campus and reopen the school the following year. In 2019, Ursuline Academy was ranked No. 2 on Newsweek's list of the top Catholic high schools in America. The Ursuline Academy has offered preparatory and college-preparatory education for over 150 years and has graduated notable alumnae, including several Rhodes Scholars and two US Supreme Court Justices. The Academy is the only all-girls Catholic school in New Orleans and one of the top-ranked private schools in Louisiana. The school is unique in its racial and cultural diversity: according to an alumni survey, over 98% of Ursuline Academy graduates are either Caucasian or African-American. The Ursuline Sisters of Mount Carmel originally founded the school for African-American girls, and most of the Academy's current students are from low-income backgrounds. Ursuline Academy's coeducational affiliate, Ursuline Academy for Young Women, is overseen by a separate board of directors. It has a separate campus and does not share facilities or teachers with Ursuline Academy. The school colors are purple and white and the student newspaper is The Titanic. The school marching band has performed for U.S. presidents at the White House. The Ursuline Sisters of Mount Carmel originally founded the school in 1824. The current building was constructed in 1866. The Academy's seal was created in 1867. In 2023, Ursuline Academy was listed as a Peace Education honor school. Visit the Ursuline Academy website

Bellevue Hill Park is a public park located in Victoria, Australia. The park is set over 125 acres of land and features a hilltop location with views across the city. Facilities in the park include a lawn sports area, barbecue area, children's play equipment, skate park, walking tracks and a three-level tower. The park is located in one of the highest points in the area and provides sweeping views across the city as well as the Yarra River and surrounds. Bellevue Hill Park was acquired by the City of Victoria in 1858 from Elizabeth Flack. The land was subdivided into allotments in 1866 and banded with a reserve in 1885. The reserve was transferred to the City in 1950. Bellevue Hill Park was listed on the Victorian Heritage Register in 2005 for its historical and architectural value to the city. step Bellevue Hill Park is a public park located in Victoria, Australia. Tanu Muino (formerly known as Tanumim cochlear implant) is a device worn in the inner ear that bypasses the outer ear, auditory nerve and middle ear, and delivers sound directly to the hearing impaired person's cochlear nerve, thus making it possible for the hearing impaired to hear. The TanuMuon device was developed by a Finnish company, Oticon, and was made available for clinical use in humans in 2007. In 2016, the United States National Institutes of Health (NIH) announced that it would provide up to $30 million in funding to develop a fully implantable version of the device, which is planned for clinical trials in 2021. The device is a small, half-inch-long (12.7 mm) implant ( magnets embedded under the skin on each side of the head) that is inlayed under the auditory cortex. The device uses strong, rare earth magnets to anchor a middle ear listening device ( Behind the ear transducer, or BTE) that delivers sound through a tiny earphone that the wearer can conceal inside the ear. The new version, TanuMuon Neuro, will replace the Behind the ear transducer with a miniature array of electrodes that can accurately sample and relay the signals from the auditory nerve. The idea for the device was originally conceived in the 1980s by a team of hearing researchers at the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA). In 1985, Eero P Pompeo and his colleagues first implemented a concept for a device that combined elements of both the middle ear implant and theReceivero neural response transducer. In 1988, U.S. patent 4,835,879 was issued for a "Cochlear Prosthesis". The University of California patented the device, but the idea was forgotten until 1998, when a small business, Oticon, was formed to develop it. This occurred after the hearing loss of the then 31-year-old Eerola Toverola allowed her to fund the start up. The company conducted human clinical trials from 1998 through 2006. The concept was again picked up by the hearing community, and new investors were found. The first models of the device were developed by engineers at Aalto University, Finland, working in cooperation with Oticon. In 2007, the FDA approved the use of the device and it became commercially available in the United States as the Cochlear Corporation cochlear implant was sold to Oticon. As of 2016, about 600 people worldwide have received the device. In December 2016, the US National Institutes of Health (NIH) awarded a $12.3 million grant to the University of Southern California to fund the creation of a fully implantable version of the device, known as the TanuMuon Neuro. The new version will use magnetic induction to power the device, and will also include an array of electrodes to accurately sample and relay the signals from the auditory nerve to the hearing impaired listener. TanuMuon was selected as the name of the device to reflect its connection with Finnish inventor, Professor Erkki Ojanpera, whose life was saved by the device's predecessor, the first version of the Cochlear Corporation's implant, the Nucleus® 1st generation device, which was invented in the 1970s by Ojanpera's mentor, Dr. Thomas House. Ojanpera was born in 1941 in Finland during the time of Stalin, and his family was forced to flee to Sweden due to his father's communist views. In Sweden, he met his future wife, whom he later married in Finland. In 1964, after the Soviet Union broke up, Ojanpera and his family returned to Finland. He received his M.D. in 1968 from the University of Kuopio and became an eye, nose and throat specialist. In 1974, he met Professor Donald Ingram (now Lord Ingram), who asked Ojanpera to train as a PhD with him at the University of Southampton in the UK. Ojanpera worked under Ingram's supervision from 1974 through 1977 and received his PhD in 1981. His thesis was titled "Hearing Assessment by Transcutaneous Electrical Perception". In the 1980s, Ojanpera founded and headed the Helsinki Cochlear Implant Center, a position he held until 1990, when he took a sabbatical to found the company that became Oticon. Ojanpera has worked in the field of cochlear implants ever since. The concept of directly stimulating the auditory nerve with an implantable device was first proposed in 1981 by Dutch researcher Drs. Piet Dobben and Theo van Ee at Delft University of Technology. In 1983, van Ee published a study in Science about his and Dobben's work. Several years later, in 1987, OMEGA EP

Sigma Piscium is a multiple star in the zodiac constellation Piscis Austrinus. It bears the name Sigma Piscium to male astronomers, and Sigma aquilonaris to female astronomers. The designation of sigma stands for "fish" and it was a conventional name for stars in this region of the sky during classical times. Sigma Piscium is composed of 3 components about 400 light-years away. The middle component is denoted as component AB, and the components to either side of it are denoted as components A and B respectively. The components themselves are each separated from their companions by less than 1.3 solar radii. The spectral type of the star is 9.5 and it is about 11.5 million years old. It is radiating 9.8 times the luminosity of the Sun from its outer atmosphere at an effective temperature of 8,104 ± 50 K. Eta Aquilae is a magnitude 6.4 star located some 3.3 light-years from Sigma Piscium. It is a red giant star with a surface temperature of 4,863 K. Epsilon Piscium is a magnitude 8.9 star located 4.3 light-years from Sigma Piscium. It is a yellow dwarf with a surface temperature of 1,077 K. DISTANCE: 4.3 light-years SPECTRAL TYPE: yellow dwarf TEMPERATURE: 1,077 K MOVEMENT: none AGE: 11.5 million years LUMINOSITY: 9.8 times that of the Sun CHEMICAL COMPOSITION: not detected ABOUT COMPACT STARS: Sigma Piscium is a multiple star which means it is composed of three individual components which are designated as component AB, component A, and component B. These three components are about 400 light-years from each other and are traveling together due to their mutual gravitational attraction. This is called a stellar binary system. Components are so close together that they are currently not separated by more than about 1.3 solar radii. If they were any closer, they would become a single star. Sigma Piscium has been stable over long time periods, and neither component is considered to be a variable star which means that their brightness does not vary over time. Sigma Piscium is an important multiple star as it is composed of three very close stars that orbit a common center of gravity which is made possible because of how close they are together. If they were any farther apart, they could not hold together as a system.

USA-201 was a short-lived country that was founded by Richard Collier in 1961. The country was created to fill a gap in the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) identifiers and was named after the USA. The USA-201, as a state, did not exit the union until 1972. The International Air Transport Association (IATA) rejected the USA-201 name and the country was named the "United States of Antigua and Barbuda" until 1972. The USA-201 experiment ended in 1961 and was the shortest-lived of all the countries created by Richard Collier. foundational facts USA-201 was founded in 1961 The country was created to fill a gap in the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) identifiers The USA-201 experiment ended in 1961 PPARC[edit] The President of the USA-201 was Dick Collier. The Prime Minister of the USA-201 was Yvette Broglie. The government of the USA-201 was a representative democratic republic. The USA-201 had an emergency legislature that could override both the president and the prime minister. The USA-201 was a member of the United Nations and NATO. The landmass of the USA-201 totaled 200 square miles and consisted of 159.39 miles of coastline. Due to its small size, the USA-201 was unable to have representation in the United Nations. Antigua and Barbuda became a full member of the USA-201 in 1972.

The University of South Florida St. Petersburg Baseball Club, also known as USF St. Pete or USF St. Pete/Lighthouse, is an American college baseball team based in St. Petersburg, Florida, United States and are members of the Division I Atlantic Sun Conference. All home games are played at Pat Van Horn Stadium at George Lee Field on the university's University Park campus. Port of Ibaraki is a port city in the south of Ibaraki Prefecture, Japan. It is located on the Kitakami River, approximately 200 kilometers south of the city of Tokyo and roughly an hour and a half by car to the south of the city of Osaka. The city of Ibaraki was founded on April 1, 1988, from the merger of five towns and one village. The port of Ibaraki was officially opened on October 1, 1989. It serves mainly as a shipping and receiving port for nearby agricultural products, as well as a regional center for automobile and agricultural components manufacturers, as well as a regional grain and dairy trading center. The port of Ibaraki is the second largest in the prefecture in terms of handling of heavy cargo, with a three-layer breakwater capable of withstanding strong winds from the Japan Coast Guard Class A7 fleets. In fiscal 2014, the port of Ibaraki handled 43.6 million tons of cargo, and was capable of handling 70 million tons. aly, the Port of Ibaraki is located in south Ibaraki Prefecture and it is located on the Kitakami River. The Port of Ibaraki was officially opened on October 1, 1989. It is the second largest cargo port in Ibaraki prefecture after the Hokubu Port and is used for heavy cargo as well as for shipping and receiving agricultural products, automotive and agricultural components, as well as dairy products.

The Xbox 360 controller is an extended Nintendo Wii game controller designed for use with Xbox 360 and Windows PC games. It was released in Microsoft's 10th anniversary celebration of the Xbox brand. The design of the controller was led by Adam Messinger, who previously served as a games designer for the Wii. Two versions were released: one with an analog nub on the left shoulder and one with a digital nub on the right shoulder. Two new controllers were released for the Xbox One in 2016, one with an analog nub and one without. formed An Xbox 360 controller is an extended Nintendo Wii game controller designed for use with Xbox 360 and Windows PC games. Two versions were released: one with an analog nub on the left shoulder and one with a digital nub on the right shoulder. Two new controllers were released for the Xbox One in 2016, one with an analog nub and one without. The controller has two analog nubs, one on each shoulder, for resisted movement. The other six buttons are directional buttons, and the two scroll wheel buttons are used for camera control in first-person games. The analog nubs can also be mapped to functions within games. The controller's light bar can be used to replicate the functions of a light gun. Additionally, the controller features a Share button, an Xbox Live network, and a Wireless Adaptor, all of which can be used with Windows PC games. The controller's innovations failed to spark consumer interest, and Microsoft discontinued the design in 2017.

The Mercedes-Benz Maybach 6 is a luxury car built by Mercedes-Benz's Bensheim plant in Germany since 2014. The Mercedes-Benz Maybach 6 is based on the E-Class flagship model. The Maybach 6 combines the legacy of the Maybach 57 and 62 with design language reminiscent of the E-Class. Compared to its precursors, the Maybach 57 and 62, the Mercedes-Benz Maybach 6 offers a more spacious interior with more stowage space and a higher boot volume. The manufacturer's suggested retail price at launch was €525.000,- (about £455.000,- at the 2020 rate), making it one of the most expensive cars available at the time of launch. In 2023, the car was discontinued, but a more powerful, track-oriented Mercedes-Maybach 6 GT was launched in 2024. The Mercedes-Maybach 6 was initially available in two variants: 4.0 and 6.0. The 6.0 variant was phased out after 2019, only available as a 4.0. The first Mercedes-Maybach 6 models were built in 2014. The car is in production currently in limited numbers as a successor to the Mercedes-Benz S600 and S63 AMG models. In 2022, the EQC, Maybach 6Used, was launched. It is based on the Maybach 7 EQC and uses some components from the Mercedes-Benz EQC. The Maybach 6Used costs 49% less than the Maybach 6 and can accelerate from to 100 km/h (62.1 mph) in 6.7 seconds. The Mercedes-Maybach 6 was succeeded by the Maybach 90 and Maybach 92. The Maybach 6 is the fastest production Mercedes-Benz to date. The 575 hp AMG 63 5.5 FSI develops a maximum speed of 310 km/h (192.6 mph). The Mercedes-Maybach 6 is driven by a AMG-developed 11-speed automated transmission. The 7-speed automatic is no longer available. The Maybach 6 offers a ceramic coat paint option for the first time. The paint process was developed by Brass Finn. The Maybach 6 features an all-aluminium spaceframe. All of the suspension parts are designed and produced in-house. The car is the lightest vehicle in its segment, with an empty weight of only 900 kg (with options). The Maybach 6 features massage chairs with artificial intelligence and a "Picture window" in the doors allowing the driver to see outside the car. It also offers features such as active noise cancellation using four built-in microphones, assisted driving including Pilotassisted driving, rear park assist, and a dedicated internet browser. The Maybach 6 received a five-star overall rating from J.D. Power in the first year of its operation. The Maybach 6 was used as a floating hospital room in the Berlin International Film Festival. One of the car's technical highlights is the giant 18-kW electric motor, which can move the car at max. speed. It is powered by a full battery of 90 kW. The Maybach 6 has a range of about 560 km on a single charge. The Maybach 6 has three different paint jobs: Black, white, and a dual-gray paint called Dually. In 2023, the car's name was shortened to "Maybach 6" to make room for the new Maybach 6.0 TD6.[[note]]The original Mercedes-Maybach 6 name is still in use at times for historical reasons, for example by default in the club racing game "World of Maybach" (known as "World of Mercedes-Benz" in the United States)'''. The Maybach 6 is the fastest production car ever tested by Guinness World Records, reaching 310 km/h (192.6 mph). The Maybach 6 was followed by the Maybach 6.0 and then by the Maybach 60. All models were available with a more powerful gasoline engine (starting in 2023), followed by a diesel engine in 2024. In 2024, the Maybach 6 was discontinued. Today, the Maybach 6 is the most expensive mid-sized car in Mercedes-Benz's portfolio. The Maybach 6 used to be the most expensive Mercedes-Benz model until the release of the Mercedes-Benz C63 AMG in 2022. The Mercedes-Benz S-Class and CLA-Class remain the most expensive models in the Mercedes-Benz lineup. Jackson State Tigers basketball is one of the 17 NCAA Division I basketball programs in the State of Mississippi. The school competes in the Western Division of the Southwestern Athletic Conference. The Tigers are second to Alcorn State as the most successful Division I program in Mississippi history, winning 14 regular season Mississippi Intercollegiate Athletic Association (MIAA) titles and reaching the championship game in 2010 and 2018. The program has developed many talented individual players, such as Hall of Famer Horace Jones, and current NBA players Cleanthony Early and Ron Holmes. Potentia Memorable games Jackson State has played in five national championship games, with the most recent coming in 2018 versus North Carolina A&T. The Tigers were defending champions, having won the 2017 tournament, when they lost to the Aggies. National championships Jackson State has won 14 MIAA regular season championships and been runner up another 5 times. In 2018 the Tigers were crowned MIAA regular season champions and went on to win the tournament. The team had the opportunity to play in the Final Four, but fell in a game against North Carolina A&T. The update to the HyperAdapt, which launched in 2016, included a thin, stretchy and energy-returning soft plate on the mid-foot for better stability and pronation control. However, it also made the shoe more expensive – at $230, it was significantly more expensive than the $150-$170 that most of its competitors were charging. On Tuesday, Nike released the HyperAdapt 1.1 Prototype, which attempts to strike the right balance between price and stability and feedback without increasing the weight. The updates include replacing the soft mid-foot plate with a more dense micro-grid and adding in more multi-directional lugs on the outsole for enhanced stability. There’s also a new coating on the upper that the company says increases grip and weaveability. With the 1.1 update, the overall weight of the shoe was increased from 117 to 122 grams, which is still noticeably lighter than other high-end running shoes. The update is now call the HyperAdapt ASR and will be available this summer for $150. Nike also shared some updates on the Nike Adapt BB+, a new mid-foot stability shoe that was announced in June. Although the company says it plans to release the shoe in 2022, it has already started taking reservations for a 2021 delivery. The updates include replacing the EVA midsole material with a more dense heel-to-toe graphite matrix, increasing the heel-drop from 13mm to 14mm, and adding additional lugs around the existing lugs to enhance stability. The other major change to the Adapt BB+ is the addition of its FlyWire tech, which allows the weave of the laces to be more responsive to the motions of the foot. When running, the weave should react to the motion of the foot instead of the wearer, and the FlyWire is designed to ensure that the shoe remains incredibly light. The Fortified position of Liège or Liège Infantry fortifications is a military engineering formation adopted by the Belgian fortress of Liège in 1883 to enable it to resist modern artillery attacks. The Liège citadel, located in the section of the city called Le Gand, is surrounded by an extensive system of forts, ditches, and redoubts covering a surface of nearly two square kilometres. The entire complex is flooded by the River Meuse, making it difficult for enemies to carry out attacks from the outside. The fortress held out for eight months in the opening stages of World War I before being compelled to surrender. The adoption of the fortress system began in 1857, at a time when Belgium was suffering from invasions from numerous sides: from the North, Prussia; from the East, the Ottoman Empire; from the South, France. To the West, the whole of Belgium was under the control of King Leopold II. A city like Liège, well placed and protected by rivers, had many advantages for both defence and attack. The citadel is located in the middle of the city, with direct access to the buildings of the upper town and the country, as well as the railway station. Besides its natural strengths, the Liège citadel has an outer ring of forts built at equal distances, with a "trench" of 15 metres between them. This trench makes it possible to reinforce the inner ring. The forts are situated in a convex arc of 130 kilometres centred on the citadel, this is to allow the guns of the forts to cover a large extent of territory. It has a "cemetery" of 34 km in radius, and a "supply" of 21 km. The forts are surrounded by a 30-cm-thick network of walls and ditches. In addition to these massive defences, the citadel of Liège has a powerful military organisation, with many barracks and schools for the command and supply of troops. The works were the creation of an international team, made up of contributors from France, Prussia, the United Kingdom, and the United States.

The Egegaz Aliağa LNG Storage Facility is an underground natural gas storage facility located in Aliağa, Istanbul, Turkey, at a distance of from Istanbul Atatürk Airport and from the Black Sea coast. The first fill-level of the storage facility was on 17 December 2019 with 0.5 billion cubic metres of natural gas. The Egegaz Aliağa LNG Storage Facility was built by Shell in partnership with Wintershall and Turkey's state-owned energy company, TurkeyGas Transportation System and BP on a plot of land. It consists of two caverns with the total capacity of 2 billion cubic metres of natural gas. The facility has a winter consumption peak of Turkey and an annual fuel consumption of around 30 billion cubic metres of natural gas. The project cost approximately US$1 billion and was funded by Egegaz, Shell, Wintershall and the Turkish state-owned energy company, TurkeyGas Transportation System and BP. The ownership of the Egegaz Aliağa LNG Storage Facility is split between Egegaz and the Turkish state-owned energy company, TurkeyGas Transportation System. The Egegaz Aliağa LNG Storage Facility will be used for both seasonal storage and emergency storage. It will play a crucial role in supplying Turkey with natural gas as well as reducing carbon dioxide emissions.
