Chief of the General Staff (North Macedonia) is a military position in North Macedonia, with the rank of General of the Army. The Chief of the General Staff is the second highest rank of the Armed Forces of the Republic of North Macedonia, and the commander of the General Staff is the operational head of the North Macedonia Armed Forces. The current Chief of the General Staff (North Macedonia) is General Valentin Doričevski, since 14 April 2019. The first Chief of the General Staff (North Macedonia) was general Željko Krščanac. The Chief of the General Staff is appointed by the president of the Republic of North Macedonia, based on proposals by the government. Formerly, the position was filled by the deputy Chief of the General Staff. The General of the Army of the Republic of North Macedonia is the highest rank of the Armed Forces of the Republic of North Macedonia that can be reached without being a member of the General Staff. The General of the Army is a four-star general that commands the land forces of the Republic of North Macedonia. The rank was established with the independence of North Macedonia and it is the highest rank of the land forces. Since 8 October 2018, the General of the Army is Major General Nebojsa Momciŝički. He succeeded General Valter Manya, who retired after reaching this rank on 29 March 2018. Manya was succeeded by General Mihail Lazarov as deputy chief of the general staff. General Lazarov was also succeeded by Momciŝički, who was the Chief of Army General staff before becoming General of the Army. The first General of the Army was general Igor Pushki. frame Chief of the General Staff (North Macedonia) is a military position in North Macedonia, with the rank of General of the Army.

Scottish School of Contemporary Dance was founded in 1983 by dancer and choreographer Kathleen Ritter. The school offers classes in several disciplines of contemporary dance, including but not limited to: ballet, pointe, modern, silks, Cunningham, lyrical, and street dance. The school's expansive facility is also home to the Diablo Dancing Academy, a division that offers classes in belly dance and kickboxing. Entertainment-sector professionals are attracted to the school's spacious facility and reputable program. Several former instructors have gone on to found their own successful dance companies, including Sammy J. Davenport (Fearless Turning) and Paul "Sugarfoot" Robinson (Jubilee!). originally known as the Contemporary Arts Center (CAC), the school was renamed in 2005 in order to increase its outreach and recognition. In 2016, the school was acquired by the Siuzo Company, a large for-profit company that runs art schools and has operated studios across the country. In 2017, the school's admission requirements were temporarily suspended after allegations of financial mismanagement were raised, but were reinstated the following year. In January 2023, Siuzo announced plans to sell the school as part of a wider move to restructure its asset portfolio. Following failed attempts to reach a buyer, the Siuzo Company was placed into administration in February 2023. The U.S. Federal government's bailout program took over the ownership of the school, and announced that it would begin negotiations to sell the assets to an as-yet-undisclosed buyer. The sale was completed in September 2023. Sylvie Morel was appointed as the school's new director. She had previously worked with the school as an instructor and administrator for over three decades. Upon completion of a nearly two-year nationwide search for a new owner, the Scottish School of Contemporary Dance was acquired by a group of private investors in March 2025. The school is now being run as a not-for-profit arts organization, with Sylvie Morel acting as the interim director alongside a board of directors. The Guitar Experience Festival (GEF) is an annual music festival held in the small town of Holts Summit, Missouri, hosted by guitar icon John Suhr. The three-day music festival features performances from many popular and emerging musical acts, and is consistently sold out. The festival was voted "Festival Band/Festival Frontrunner" for the fifth year in a row at the Guitar Town USA festival and Summit Music Summit. The event's co-founder and former festival organizer, Mark Hickey, was awarded the American La Roche Festival Award for "Outstanding Achievement in the Arts" in 2017. Fry's Electronics was a sponsor of the festival for many years and the festival benefitted the Ronald McDonald House Charities. Mount Druitt railway station is a transport hub in the suburb of Mount Druitt in New South Wales, Australia, located 2 kilometres west of Sydney Airport and 10 kilometres east of Central station. The railway station is served by two metro rail lines and a NSW TrainLink bus service, with connections to many other city and regional railway lines. The station is located on the Bankstown Line and the North Shore, North Sydney and Supreme lines. It is also served by three Sydney Ferries routes to Taronga Parkland Zoo, Circular Quay and Manly, as well as a road bridge to and from the M2 Hills Motorway, making it a key transport hub in western Sydney. The station has two side platforms and a connecting footbridge. The NSW government plans to eventually replace the station with a unified north-south metro line and western Sydney airport line. myself Mount Druitt railway station is a transport hub in the suburb of Mount Druitt in New South Wales, Australia, located 2 kilometres west of Sydney Airport and 10 kilometres east of Central station. I Don't Wanna Go to Bed As a teenager, there are many things that I look forward to, such as getting my driver's license and having a car, or getting an apartment of my own. These are exciting times as I get to experience the responsibilities of having my own money and a set of keys to a place that is all mine. But as exciting as these things are for me, they are extremely difficult for my mom, as she has to clean up after me, and make sure I am always safely home before she lets me have any fun. I don't wanna go to bed. When I was a kid, my mom would make my bed every night, and I would cry and tell her I wasn't sleepy. This didn't seem to matter, as she would tell me that it was time to sleep anyway, and I would just cry even more. My mom would then have to pick me up and move me to my bed, and I would kick and scream the entire time. Even now that I am an adult, I don't wanna go to bed. Every night before I go to sleep, I make sure that my room is neat and clean, and that my bed is made. I may not be tired, but I need to at least look like I am trying to sleep. I also may put on some very loud rock music, as my mom says that this helps me sleep. But guess what? I don't sleep at all. Instead, I just lie there and think about all of the things I want to do the next day, and my poor mom has to clean up after me again. I don't wanna go to bed.

România TV (full name: Romanian Television) is a television channel in Romania founded in 1990 and operating since then. The channel belongs to Romanian Media Group, the biggest media group in Romania. România TV can be seen on satellite (ID: 120,signalling on 160.32 MHz), on cable (ID: 998, on 2606-2626 MHz) and on IPTV (Cybernet). The channel has two HD versions (ID: 12, on 2710-2770 MHz and ID: 13, on 2835-2880 MHz). România TV can be watched online on the channel's website, as well as on the Romanian Television YouTube channel. The Romanian Television headquarters are located in Timișoara, together with Cancan, FashionTV, Ideal TV, Prima TV, România Film and Telemagino channels. The most popular Romanian TV shows (Big Brother, Survivor, The Voice of Italy, Britain's Got Talent, America's Next Top Model, etc.) are broadcasted within 24 hours after the Romanian version. Due to its signal reception on satellite and IPTV, România TV is partially watched in Italy, Switzerland, Kazakhstan, Russia and many other countries. The current director-general of the Romanian Television is Raluca Sârbu. Since 16 April 2018, the channel is temporarily available for all Sky TV subscribers, via the Now TV application, as a replacement for K Bucuresti, which was removed from the platform.

The Way Forward: Renewing the American Idea Wikipedia article written by user HoppinJack The American Idea was first expressed by Alexis de Tocqueville in his work "Democracy in America", where he observed that American citizens were "absorbed" in their own private affairs and that social bonds were between individuals, not groups. The American Idea has since been used by many to characterize the unique blend of individualism and communalism that defines the United States. As President Obama said in his Nobel Peace Prize speech, "The success of this experiment in self-government has given hope to millions around the world that what joins us here in this chamber – a shared commitment to justice, the rule of law, and the capacity of democratic institutions to change and improve themselves – extends not just to our little corner of the world, but to all people, in all places." Over time, however, the American Idea has come under attack as American society has become less homogenous and more divided. The nation's "great experiment" has also appeared to many to be failing as the lack of racial and gender diversity, increasing levels of income inequality, and rising violence have led many to fear that America was becoming an "other world" where diversity was being equated with lack of unity. Moreover, many viewed America's foreign policy as interventionist and imperialist, leading to anti-American sentiment and the election of Trump as president. However, many experts, including professors Richard Wright and Philip Zelikow, contend that the American Idea can be found in American society today in a remarkable way, and that Trump's election, while threatening, did not represent a rejection of the American Idea but instead its very definition. Rather than looking to a society with a unifying identity, Americans today seem to find community in differences, that is, in the intersectional identities that modernity enables. A wide gulf, they argue, separates the American Idea from the mean, vulgar, and offensive attitudes of Trump, and it is this perceived gap that gives liberals and conservatives their most cherished principles to defend. The danger today, they say, is that the Idea may be discounted, buried under a blanket of false universalism. See also American exceptionalism References Further reading Bayor, Nicholas D. and Edwin A. Homans. How the American Dream Came to America: 1848 to the Present. 3rd ed. New York: W.W. Norton & Co., 2004. Rojo were a popular UK rock band who achieved critical acclaim in the late 1980s and early 1990s. The band members were vocalist and guitarist Steve Brown, bassist Andy Lewis, drummer Phil Spikely, and guitarist Simon Peck. At the end of the 1980s, Rojo were earning a living by playing small concerts and backing other acts, including Happy Mondays, Blur and Oasis. In late 1989, they signed to Polydor Records and their debut album, Communique Static, was released in early 1990. The album's lead single, "Spanish Bomber", reached the top 5 in the UK, and the follow-up, "You'll Never Be Alone", reached No. 3. Their second album, Crucial, was released in 1994 and produced two further Top 5 hits with "Sure thing" and "Diversion". Rojo disbanded in 1996. Steve Brown and Andy Lewis formed The Treatment, and Phil Spikely and Simon Peck formed Oblivion Sun. Brown and Lewis later achieved success as songwriters and record producers. Awards In 1990, Rojo were nominated for a Brit Award for Best International Group. The band also won the Gold Badge Award at the 1993 Mobius Awards for their single "Sure Thing". later life Steve Brown and Andy Lewis formed The Treatment. Phil Spikely and Simon Peck formed Oblivion Sun. Field of the Invention The present invention relates to a method of processing a scapholunate interosseous ligament, and more particularly, to a method of preserving and transplanting the scapholunate interosseous ligament. 2. Description of the Related Art The scapholunate interosseous ligament is a ligamentous complex that stabilizes the scaphoid and the lunate bones of the wrist. It is a well-known finding that complete rupture of the scapholunate ligament complex causes typical subscaphoideal radiolunate instability, which is commonly known as dorsal subluxation of the distal radioulnar joint. Osteocutaneous flaps of the fibula have traditionally been used to reconstruct the scapholunate ligament, but complications such as stiffness of the wrist and loss of strength in the transferred fibula have been reported. Using the muscle-tendon unit of the hypothenar eminence for reconstruction of the scapholunate ligament has been proposed as a good alternative to using an osteocutaneous flap. Preserving the scapholunate ligament with the attached muscle-tendon unit can prevent loss of strength in the reconstructed scapholunate ligament, as well as the associated complications, such as stiffness of the wrist. However, the complex relationship between the scapholunate ligament and the muscle-tendon unit makes it difficult to detach the muscle-tendon unit from the structures without damaging the muscle-tendon unit. Additionally, if the detached muscle-tendon unit is not preserved properly, the biomechanics of the reconstructed wrist joint may be affected. Thus, a method of preserving and transplanting the scapholunate interosseous ligament with the attached muscle-tendon unit is needed to overcome the aforementioned deficiencies.<|endoftext|>/* * (C) Copyright 2002 * Wolfgang Denk, DENX Software Engineering, wd@denx.de. * * SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-2.0+ */ #ifndef __TFT_H__ #define __TFT_H__ #define BT_DEFAULT_ROW_ADDR 0xFF #define TFT_DEFAULT_HEIGHT 16 #define TFT_DEFAULT_WIDTH 160 #define TFT_DEFAULT_INIT_SEQ (TFT_CE|TFT_RW|TFT_DEN|TFT_NLS|TFT_HS) /* LCD parallel mode */ #define LCD_PCLK (*(vu_char *)KP_CLK) /* Chip select pin */ #define CS_CAFS (*(vu_char *)GPIO_NUM_2) #define CS_SPSO (*(vu_char *)GPIO_NUM_3) #define CS_NSS_PIN

Hyacinthoides paivae, also known as paivae hyacinth, Cape hyacinth, or silver waterlily, is a rare plant species found only in South Africa. Originally discovered in 1727 by Frederick Maurice Clifford, it was rediscovered in 2006 by scientists working in the Drakensberg, the range of mountains where it is found. The exact distribution of the species is still uncertain, but it is likely to be declining due to habitat loss. The name of the species is derived from the Paiva horse, a breed of horse also known as the Anglo-Arab. Clifford's assistant, Andrew Payment, brought the seed of the plant home with him on this horse, and the breed is commemorated in the genus name of the plant and the epithet of the species. Hyacinthoides paivae is a large perennial herb, growing up to 2 m tall. It has broad linear leaves, between 10 and 20 cm long and 3 and 5 cm wide, varying in colour from dark green to blue-green. The large, showy flowers are yellow, orange or red, sometimes with darker centres. The species is named for the large, showy, central flowers. The flowers appear from September to November, depending on the altitude, and last for a few weeks. The plant grows in grassy mountain habitats at altitudes of 2000 to 3000 m, and is threatened by habitat loss. It is classified as "vulnerable" on the IUCN Red List, and several subspecies have been named. The number of populations is uncertain, but there are thought to be fewer than 2000 mature individuals. Hyacinthoides paivae is closely related to the closely-related H. majalis, H. pubescens, H. intermedia and H. versicolor. It can be distinguished by its larger leaves, which are sometimes variegated, the colour of the flowers and the distribution range. Hyacinthoides paivae requires well-drained soil, full sun and snowfall each year, with a period of frost. It grows well in captivity, and has been propagated by cuttings. As a vulnerable species, the Paiva hyacinth has the world's attention, and it is being cared for by the South African National Parks. This includes propagation, monitoring and maintenance of populations, with the aim of growing enough plants to repopulate areas of suitable habitat. A number of organizations are involved, including Paiva horse breeders, private landowners and government agencies. The propagation and monitoring of populations is a joint initiative between the Drayden Valley Farmers' Union and the provincial Department of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries. Paiva horse breeders are providing seeds and allowing plants to be propagated for reintroduction into suitable habitats. The range of the species is being monitored by the Eastern Cape regional office of the South African National Parks, using traditional knowledge and landscape-level mapping. The goal is to increase the number of populations from the present few thousand to at least 10,000, and to document the species' distribution. To this end, Paiva horse breeders are being trained to conduct vegetation mapping. Paiva horse breeders and the provincial Department of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries are also working to secure landowners' permission to establish populations on their land. In addition, Paiva horse breeders are establishing "spreader populations", which can be used to expand the distribution of plants once they have been introduced into suitable habitat. Spreader populations will provide a source of seeds that can be dispersed by blowing or hand-cast. The Paiva horse is a small, rare, native horse breed that originated in South Africa. It is named after Andrew Payment's Paiva horse, which carried the first-known sample of the species to science in 1727. It is a hardy and intelligent breed, used for driving and riding, but has almost been extinct since the 19th century. Paiva horse breeders are working to save this breed from extinction by propagating and reintroducing it into suitable habitat. This will be done by mapping suitable habitat and distributing plants to establish populations, with monitoring and maintenance by South African National Parks. The Eastern Cape regional office of South African National Parks is coordinating the initiative, which will use traditional knowledge and landscape-level mapping, as well as training Paiva horse breeders in mapping. The goal is to increase the number of populations from the present few thousand to at least 10,000, and to document the species' distribution. Paiva horse breeders are being trained to conduct vegetation mapping. Landowners who own land that could potentially be suitable for the establishment of populations are being encouraged to participate. They will need to secure permission before allowing the establishment

CHKT (900 MHz band) is a radio band used for wireless communications. It is located in the microwave range of the electromagnetic spectrum, typically defined as beginning at 300 MHz and extending upwards to 300,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 Hz. The CHKT band was formerly used for military communications in the United States and other countries, and is now used primarily for broadband wireless Internet and other low-power communications applications. mag CHKT (900 MHz band) is a radio band used for wireless communications. It is located in the microwave range of the electromagnetic spectrum, typically defined as beginning at 300 MHz and extending upwards to 300,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 Hz. The CHKT band was formerly used for military communications in the United States and other countries, and is now used primarily for broadband wireless Internet and other low-power communications applications. Notably, the 900 MHz band was the original target of the 2020 US Federal Communication Commission (FCC) incentive auction, which was intended to financially incentivize the transition from private to public ownership of band frequencies. However, the auction failed to meet its goals, leading the FCC to cancel the sale of spectrum in the band and striking a new plan to monetize the band through other means. The band's former radio equipment must be removed from the band by 2020. Communications in the 900 MHz band occur at very low power levels and are highly directional, making the band well-suited for remote transmission of data and communicating control signals between entities that are proximate to each other, but not widely distributed. Examples of use of the band include WiFi and Bluetooth connections between smartphones, and online streaming services such as Netflix and YouTube take advantage of the band's high capacity and low cost. Although the band is lightly used, regulators have expressed concern about harmful emissions in the vicinity of the band's communications caused by accidental or intentional radiators. While the 900 MHz band is not closed to new devices, manufacturers are not required to certify their equipment in the band, making it difficult for consumers to purchase equipment that operates in the band. Although the 900 MHz band is a prime candidate for unlicensed use, its current regulatory situation has deterred private industry from developing significant use of the band for commercial communication purposes. Additionally, the band is subject to interference from other licensed systems using the band, especially when operating near larger urban areas. Industry participants view a relocation of the band to a higher portion of the radio spectrum as an attractive solution to these problems, but there are no extant plans to relocate the band at this time.

Computer America was a supercomputer at NASA Langley Research Center, which was dedicated on September 29, 2011 and retired in June 21, 2023. Computer America was capable of performing 80 trillion calculations per second, this made it the fourth most powerful supercomputer in the world as of 2011. sound like something you could do with a computer in the year 2023? well in 2021 America started to worry about its economic future andComputer America was commissioned to help find a solution. Over the next decade America became detached from the rest of the world as its powers becameneeded for NASA research. After decades of service America was retired in 2112, and turned into an museum with public tours. ADVERTISEMENT internet in the late 20th century led to the development of supercomputers, as large computing systems were cost-effective for the first time. The first generation of supercomputers were built out of custom designed chips built by companies like IBM, Advanced Micro Devices and Nvidia. The cost of building a supercomputer was heavily dependant on the amount of processors and storage you wanted, the more powerful the computer the more you had to pay for the components. BACK America was the first supercomputer to be built out of off-the-shelf computer parts, this was made possible by innovations in internet infrastructure and cloud computing which made it feasible to have a large number of commodity servers online at any given time. This allowed for computers to be build out of more basic components, lowering the cost of building the computer.

Martin Nielsen (politician) is a Danish politician who has been Minister for the Environment between 2015 and 2019. He has been active in Danish politics since the late 1990s, but primarily in the social democratic party Socialdemokraterne. He has been a member of parliament representing the Østerbro district since 2001. He was the leader of the party's environmental committee from 2009 to 2015 and was considered a close partner of party leader Socialdemokratiet Torben Lund. As such he was considered a contender for party leader following Frederiksen's resignation in 2015. However, he was defeated in the leadership election by Socialistisk Folkeparti's Pia Kjældgaard. He was elected minister on November 4, 2015, after his party won a plurality in the general election. In September 2019, he was re-elected, but did not receive a ministerial post in a new government led by Lars Løkke Rasmussen. periodicity Martin Nielsen (politician) is a Danish politician who has been Minister for the Environment between 2015 and 2019. A Letter for Tomorrow <begin letter> July 4, 2023 My Dearest <His/Her/Their>, By now you have received my initial message. Perhaps you have read the text messages I sent two years ago. If not, I hope you still have those. If so, it is likely that you have found this letter by now. If I had the chance, I would tell you everything from the very beginning. I would explain to you how I came to write this letter and all the decisions and twists of fate that brought us here today. I would tell you how I first met your mother. How my life changed the day you were born. And how we found out less than a year later that you would be happy. But now all of that is in the past. What matters now is the future. I wish I could tell you that I have found a way to return you to your home in the past. But though I have discovered the sequence of events that led us here, I do not have the skills to change or halt them. And so, I must tell you that the letter I am now sending will reach you in the future. It is my hope that you will find it when you do. And that you will know how much I love you. And that I am sorry that I could not be with you as you start this next phase of your life. Always, Your father

The GNU Compiler Collection, commonly abbreviated GCC, is a free software project for implementing a compiler that generates code for the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) and the GNU Compiler Infrastructure (GCI) LLVM. It is the most popular compiler for the C, C++, and Objective-C programming languages. It is released as open source, with versions 4.3.1 and later being developed in the GCC repository on GitHub. The compiler is currently developed by a large community of programmers, including individual volunteer developers as well as companies and organizations whose purpose is to contribute and improve the development of the compiler. GCC is distributed under a variety of free and open software licenses. The latest version of GCC is 7.3, released in December 2022. At the start of 2023, the GCC development team announced that they would be freezing the versions of GCC below 7.4 after 2022, and would no longer accept new features or bug fixes to GCC versions 6 or 7. New development will continue on 8 and later, with the 7.3 branch being considered fully stabilized. The following year, the GCC development team again reduced the support period for versions 6 and 7. Now only security fixes for these versions will be accepted; new features and bug fixes will no longer be developed for them, and they will no longer receive security updates. The 6 series is still supported by vendor releases such as those from Apple, and a 7.1 release is also still available from the GCC website. In July 2023, the GCC development team informed the community that a new branch of the compiler, version 8, would be the last major release for the 6 and 7 series. From this point on, only bug fixes and security updates will be provided for those versions. The decision to stop development for versions 6 and 7 was made due to a lack of developer interest, with no new features being proposed for inclusion, and existing features being subject to debate on whether or not to retain compatibility with older software that depends on them. The freezing of versions also reduces the need to support these older versions, and so reduces the associated costs. There are still some users who need support for older versions, and so vendors are still providing security updates for versions 6.13 and 6.14, as well as major releases 7.0, 7.1, 7.2, and 7.3. The GCC development team will continue to provide security updates for the 8 series, until at least 2024. The GCC compiler is used by several other free compilers for similar languages, including LLVMc for C++. The GCC compiler is used in many distributions' installation media. For instance, the Fedora Project uses it to create the Fedora operating system, and Ubuntu uses it to create its installation DVDs. The GCC compiler supports a large number of programming language features and has a large user and developer community. Its popularity stems in part from its mature feature set and ease of use, but also from its GPL v3-licensed software architecture, which provides access to the inner workings of the compiler for implementers and researchers. The GCC Compiler Collection is the most popular compiler for the C, C++, and Objective-C programming languages. It is open source and has a large development and user community. For more information: * https://www.gnu.org/software/gcc-compiler-collection/ * Richard Stallman, the founder of the Free Software Foundation, and the Free Software Foundation's president, wrote the original proposal that became the foundation of the GCC project.
